org.itemscript.core.foundries
Class Foundry<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.itemscript.core.foundries.Foundry<T>
Type Parameters:
T - 
public abstract class Foundry<T>
extends java.lang.Object

A Foundry is a class that facilitates the creation of instance objects. It contains a map of Factory objects. The right factory is found for a JsonObject, and that factory is used to create a Java object.

Author:
Jacob Davies jacob@itemscript.org

public T create(java.lang.String name)
Create an instance of an object using the supplied name to find the factory. No parameters will be supplied to the factory.

Parameters:

create

public T create(java.lang.String name,
                JsonObject params)
Create an instance of an object using the supplied name to locate the factory. The given parameters will be supplied to the factory.

get

public final Factory<T> get(java.lang.String name)
Get a Factory by name.

Parameters:
name -
Returns:

getFactoryNameParameter

public abstract java.lang.String getFactoryNameParameter()
The key of the parameter inside the JsonObject parameter object that contains the name of the factory to use to create an instance. For instance, for a WidgetFactory this would be "widget"

Returns:

makeFactoryNameFromDefinition

protected abstract FactoryName<T> makeFactoryNameFromDefinition(java.lang.String name,
                                                                JsonObject factoryJson)
A method that makes a factory for objects of this type from a JSON definition. Not all Registries will implement this, as not all of them can make a generic Factory like this.

Parameters:
factoryJson -
Returns:
